title: Friction - two blocks accelerating up a ramp

content.question: A small block of mass <math alttext="lowercase m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is on top of a large block of mass <math alttext="uppercase M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> on a ramp that is at an angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the horizontal, as shown in the figure. The large block is pulled by a string as the blocks accelerate together up the ramp. The coefficients of kinetic and static friction between all surfaces are <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math>, respectively.
